name: homonymic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of words) having the same spelling or pronunciation or both, but different meanings; relating to words like this: The wordlist was comprised of eighty homonymic pairs. The imperative form is homonymic with the third person singular present tense indicative. Related words
homonym
homonymy
More examplesFewer examplesAs with other languages, Italian has homonymic features.In this case, two words which are homonymic puns in the same language generate two different sentences.A word may have several translations because it is a polysemic or homonymic word (e.g., light, which can be translated as both lumière “light bulb” and léger “low-fat” in French).Four of these six prepositions which children learn later are homonymic.
